instrument noun [C]
(MUSIC)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 (also musical instrument) an object, such as a piano, guitar, or drum, that is played to produce musical sounds: play an instrument Which instrument do you play?
More examplesFewer examplesWhen a piece of music is recorded, each instrument is recorded separately on a 24- or 48-track tape.If you want to learn to play a musical instrument, it might be a good idea to begin on something simple.This wooden instrument is the ancestor of the modern metal flute.The family all play instruments - they're all very musical.The trumpet and trombone are brass instruments.

instrument noun [C]
(TOOL)
C1 a tool or other device, especially one without electrical power, used for performing a particular piece of work: surgical instruments instruments of torture The man's injuries had obviously been caused by a blunt instrument.
a device used for measuring speed, height, etc. in vehicles, especially aircraft: the instrument panel The lightning had damaged the plane's instruments, and they weren't giving any readings.
C2 formal a way of achieving or causing something: instrument of He saw the theatre as an instrument of change - a way of forcing people to consider social and political issues.
More examplesFewer examplesThe main instruments are in the centre of the control panel.The doctor used a sharp instrument to dig a piece of glass out of my finger.Lewis estimates that 40 to 80 percent of dentists actually autoclave their instruments as they should.The museum has a large collection of vicious medieval torture instruments.The instrument panel was brightly illuminated.
